This dataset contains soil type and soil classification, by area.rnAdditional info at: http://mcdc.cas.psu.edu/datawiz.htm; http://co.centre.pa.us/centreco/conservation/Using_SoilMap_website_and_soildatamart.htm

If viewing this description on the Western PennsylvaniarnRegional Data Centeru2019s open data portal (
>http://www.wprdc.org), thisrndataset is harvested on a weekly basis from Allegheny Countyu2019s GIS data portalrn(

>http://openac.alcogis.opendata.arcgis.com/). Thernfull metadata record for this dataset can also be found on Allegheny Countyu2019srnGIS portal. You can access the metadata record and other resources on the GISrnportal by clicking on the u201cExploreu201d button (and choosing the u201cGo to resourceu201drnoption) to the right of the u201cArcGIS Open Datasetu201d text below.

Development Notes:u00a0 This data set is a digital soil survey andrngenerally is the most detailed level of soil geographic data developed by thernNational Cooperative Soil Survey. The information was prepared by digitizingrnmaps, by compiling information onto a planimetric correct base and digitizing,rnor by revising digitized maps using remotely sensed and other information. Thisrndata set consists of georeferenced digital map data and computerized attributerndata. The map data are in a soil survey area extent format and include arndetailed, field verified inventory of soils and miscellaneous areas thatrnnormally occur in a repeatable pattern on the landscape and that can berncartographically shown at the scale mapped. A special soil features layerrn(point and line features) is optional. This layer displays the location ofrnfeatures too small to delineate at the mapping scale, but they are large enoughrnand contrasting enough to significantly influence use and management. The soilrnmap units are linked to attributes in the National Soil Information Systemrnrelational database, which gives the proportionate extent of the componentrnsoils and their properties.u00a0 The soil maprnand data used in the SSURGO product were prepared by soil scientists as part ofrnthe National Cooperative Soil Survey

extras.value: Allegheny County / City of Pittsburgh / Western PA Regional Data Center

organization.description: Allegheny County (Pennsylvania) and the City of Pittsburgh both publish their data through the Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center. The Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center supports key community initiatives by making public information easier to find and use. The Data Center maintains Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburghu2019s open data portal, and provides a number of services to data publishers and users. The Data Center also hosts datasets from these and other public sector agencies, academic institutions, and non-profit organizations. The Data Center is managed by the University of Pittsburghu2019s Center for Social and Urban Research, and is a partnership of the University, Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburgh.
